"}, {"content": "The Hindu one.

Explanation:

In Hinduism, there are two main gods: Vishnu and Shiva. Shiva is the god of destruction, while Vishnu is the god of preservation. Shiva is often depicted as a god with a third eye, while Vishnu is often depicted as a god with four arms. Shiva is also known as the destroyer of evil, while Vishnu is known as the preserver of good. 

In Buddhism, there are two main gods: Buddha and Brahma. Buddha is the god of enlightenment, while Brahma is the god of creation. Buddha is often depicted as a wise man or a bodhisattva, while Brahma is often depicted as a creator god. 

The Buddhist person and the Hindu person may have grown up in households that worshiped these two gods, but they may not have been exposed to the other's religion until they met. Therefore, it is possible that the Hindu person grew up with friends of the same religion as their own, while the Buddhist person grew up with friends of the same religion as their own.", "role": "assistant"}]
